:mod:`kivymd`
=============

.. py:module:: kivymd


Package Contents
----------------

Classes
~~~~~~~

.. autoapisummary::

   kivymd.KivymdRecipe



.. py:class:: KivymdRecipe

   Bases: :class:`pythonforandroid.recipe.PythonRecipe`

   .. attribute:: version
      :annotation: = master

      

   .. attribute:: url
      :annotation: = https://github.com/HeaTTheatR/KivyMD/archive/{version}.zip

      

   .. attribute:: call_hostpython_via_targetpython
      :annotation: = False

      If True, tries to install the module using the hostpython binary
      copied to the target (normally arm) python build dir. However, this
      will fail if the module tries to import e.g. _io.so. Set this to False
      to call hostpython from its own build dir, installing the module in
      the right place via arguments to setup.py. However, this may not set
      the environment correctly and so False is not the default.


   .. attribute:: depends
      :annotation: = ['kivy', 'pillow', 'requests', 'setuptools']

      


.. data:: recipe
